title: BRREWABC
code: library(BRREWABC)

title: BRREWABC
code: compute_dist <- function(x, ss_obs) {   ss_sim <- c(x[["alpha"]] + x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1),               x[["alpha"]] * x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1))   dist <- sum((ss_sim - ss_obs)^2)   return(c(dist)) }  model_list <- list("m1" = compute_dist)

title: BRREWABC
code: prior_dist <- list("m1" = list(c("alpha", "unif", 0, 4),                                c("beta", "unif", 0, 1)))

title: BRREWABC
code: sum_stat_obs <- c(2.0, 0.75)

title: BRREWABC
code: res <- abcsmc(model_list = model_list,               prior_dist = prior_dist,               ss_obs = sum_stat_obs,               max_number_of_gen = 15,               nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen = 2000,               new_threshold_quantile = 0.8,               experiment_folderpath = "smpl",               max_concurrent_jobs = 5,               verbose = FALSE)

title: BRREWABC
text: Pairplot iterations Threshold evolution iterations ESS evolution iterations Density estimates alpha Density estimates beta
code: all_accepted_particles <- res$particles all_thresholds <- res$thresholds plot_abcsmc_res(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = prior_dist,                 filename = "smpl/res/figs/smpl_pairplot_all.png", colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2 plot_thresholds(data = all_thresholds, nb_threshold = 1,                 filename = "smpl/res/figs/smpl_thresholds.png", colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." plot_ess(data = all_accepted_particles,filename = "smpl/res/figs/smpl_ess.png", colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." #>    gen      ess #> 1    1 2000.000 #> 2    2 1887.125 #> 3    3 1916.676 #> 4    4 1923.161 #> 5    5 1921.736 #> 6    6 1925.409 #> 7    7 1914.072 #> 8    8 1926.901 #> 9    9 1916.933 #> 10  10 1903.345 #> 11  11 1909.445 #> 12  12 1871.871 #> 13  13 1857.138 #> 14  14 1854.153 #> 15  15 1856.094 plot_densityridges(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = prior_dist,                    filename = "smpl/res/figs/smpl_densityridges.png", colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'."

title: Estimation and model selection using ABC-SMC
code: compute_dist <- function(x, ss_obs) {   ss_sim <- c(x[["alpha"]] + x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1),               x[["alpha"]] * x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1))   dist <- sum((ss_sim - ss_obs)^2)   return(c(dist)) }  compute_dist_2 <- function(x, ss_obs) {   ss_sim <- c(x[["alpha"]] + x[["beta"]] + runif(1, -0.5, 0.5),               x[["alpha"]] * x[["beta"]] + runif(1, -0.5, 0.5))   dist <- sum((ss_sim - ss_obs)^2)   return(c(dist)) }  compute_dist_3 <- function(x, ss_obs) {   ss_sim <- c(x[["alpha"]] + x[["gamma"]] + rnorm(1, 1, 0.1),               x[["alpha"]] * x[["gamma"]] + rnorm(1, 1, 0.1))   dist <- sum((ss_sim - ss_obs)^2)   return(c(dist)) }  model_list <- list("m1" = compute_dist,                    "m2" = compute_dist_2,                    "m3" = compute_dist_3)

title: Estimation and model selection using ABC-SMC
code: prior_dist <- list("m1" = list(c("alpha", "unif", 0, 4),                                c("beta", "unif", 0, 1)),                    "m2" = list(c("alpha", "unif", 0, 4),                                c("beta", "unif", 0, 1)),                    "m3" = list(c("alpha", "unif", 0, 4),                                c("gamma", "unif", 0, 1)))

title: Estimation and model selection using ABC-SMC
code: sum_stat_obs <- c(2.0, 0.75)

title: Estimation and model selection using ABC-SMC
code: res <- abcsmc(model_list = model_list,               prior_dist = prior_dist,               ss_obs = sum_stat_obs,               max_number_of_gen = 20,               nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen = 2000,               new_threshold_quantile = 0.8,               experiment_folderpath = "mdlslctn",               max_concurrent_jobs = 5,               verbose = FALSE)

title: Estimation and model selection using ABC-SMC
text: Selected models iterations Pairplot iterations predominantly selected model Threshold evolution iterations predominantly selected model Density estimates alpha, predominantly selected model Density estimates beta, predominantly selected model
code: all_accepted_particles <- res$particles all_thresholds <- res$thresholds plot_abcsmc_res(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = prior_dist,                 filename = "mdlslctn/res/figs/mdlslctn_pairplot_all.png", colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Number of generations exceed the threshold (15) allowed by ggpairs, it may cause long processing times. You may (re)define the iter argument to choose which generations to plot." #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2 plot_densityridges(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = prior_dist,                    filename = "mdlslctn/res/figs/mdlslctn_densityridges.png", colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." plot_thresholds(data = all_thresholds, nb_threshold = 1,                 filename = "mdlslctn/res/figs/mdlslctn_thresholds.png", colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'."

title: Estimation using abc rejection
code: library(BRREWABC)

title: Estimation using abc rejection
code: compute_dist <- function(x, ss_obs) {   ss_sim <- c(x[["alpha"]] + x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1),               x[["alpha"]] * x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1))   dist <- sum((ss_sim - ss_obs)^2)   return(c(dist)) }  model_list <- list("m1" = compute_dist)

title: Estimation using abc rejection
code: prior_dist <- list("m1" = list(c("alpha", "unif", 0, 4),                                c("beta", "unif", 0, 1)))

title: Estimation using abc rejection
code: sum_stat_obs <- c(2.0, 0.75)

title: Estimation using abc rejection
code: res <- abcrejection(model_list = model_list,                     prior_dist = prior_dist,                     ss_obs = sum_stat_obs,                     nb_acc_prtcl = 1000,                     thresholds = 0.1,                     max_attempts = 100000,                     acceptance_rate_min = 0.01,                     experiment_folderpath = "smplreject",                     max_concurrent_jobs = 5,                     verbose = TRUE) #> Check folder_path for : smplreject/tmp #> Folder created successfully. #> Check folder_path for : smplreject/res #> Folder created successfully. #> Check folder_path for : smplreject/res/csv #> Folder created successfully. #> Check folder_path for : smplreject/res/figs #> Folder created successfully. #> Computation time - user : 5.480 s | system : 0.151 s | elapsed : 5.786 s  #> Experiment done!

title: Estimation using abc rejection
text: Pairplot accepted particles predefined threshold Pairplot accepted particles different acceptance thresholds
code: all_accepted_particles <- res$acc_particles all_tested_particles <- res$all_tested_particles plot_abcrejection_res(all_accepted_particles, prior_dist,                       filename="smplreject/res/figs/smplreject_pairplot.png",                       colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as '.png'." #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2 plot_abcrejection_res(all_tested_particles, prior_dist,                       thresholds=c(5.0, 4.0, 3.0, 2.0, 1.0, 0.1, 0.05, 0.01),                       filename="smplreject/res/figs/smplreject_pairplot_custom_thresholds.png",                       colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as '.png'."

title: Resume an estimation using ABC-SMC
code: compute_dist <- function(x, ss_obs) {   ss_sim <- c(x[["alpha"]] + x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1),               x[["alpha"]] * x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1))   dist <- sum((ss_sim - ss_obs)^2)   return(c(dist)) }  model_list <- list("m1" = compute_dist)

title: Resume an estimation using ABC-SMC
code: prior_dist <- list("m1" = list(c("alpha", "unif", 0, 4),                                c("beta", "unif", 0, 1)))

title: Resume an estimation using ABC-SMC
code: sum_stat_obs <- c(2.0, 0.75)

title: Resume an estimation using ABC-SMC
code: res <- abcsmc(model_list = model_list,               prior_dist = prior_dist,               ss_obs = sum_stat_obs,               max_number_of_gen = 10,               nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen = 2000,               new_threshold_quantile = 0.8,               experiment_folderpath = "rsmsmpl",               max_concurrent_jobs = 5,               verbose = FALSE)

title: Resume an estimation using ABC-SMC
text: Pairplot iterations Threshold evolution iterations Density estimates alpha Density estimates beta
code: all_accepted_particles <- res$particles all_thresholds <- res$thresholds plot_abcsmc_res(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = prior_dist,                 filename = "rsmsmpl/res/figs/rsmsmpl_pairplot_all.png", colorpal = "Greys") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2 plot_densityridges(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = prior_dist,                    filename = "rsmsmpl/res/figs/rsmsmpl_densityridges.png", colorpal = "Greys") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." plot_thresholds(data = all_thresholds, nb_threshold = 1,                 filename = "rsmsmpl/res/figs/rsmsmpl_thresholds.png", colorpal = "Greys") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'."

what: Re-run abc smc procedure from last iteration of previous results
title: Resume an estimation using ABC-SMC
text: sure update parameters defining stopping conditions may caused previous procedure terminate (max_number_of_gen).
code: res <- abcsmc(model_list = model_list,               prior_dist = prior_dist,               ss_obs = sum_stat_obs,               max_number_of_gen = 20,               nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen = 2000,               new_threshold_quantile = 0.8,               experiment_folderpath = "rsmsmpl",               max_concurrent_jobs = 5,               previous_gens = all_accepted_particles,               previous_epsilons = all_thresholds,               verbose = FALSE) #> Warning in scan(file = file, what = what, sep = sep, quote = quote, dec = dec, #> : EOF within quoted string #> Warning in scan(file = file, what = what, sep = sep, quote = quote, dec = dec, #> : EOF within quoted string #> The distance threshold(s) (epsilon(s)) fall(s) below the predetermined min value! #> [1] 0.009611137

title: Resume an estimation using ABC-SMC
text: Pairplot iterations Threshold evolution iterations Density estimates alpha Density estimates beta
code: all_accepted_particles <- res$particles all_thresholds <- res$thresholds plot_abcsmc_res(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = prior_dist,                 filename = "rsmsmpl/res/figs/rsmsmpl_pairplot_all_rsm.png", colorpal = "OrRd") #> [1] "Number of generations exceed the threshold (15) allowed by ggpairs, it may cause long processing times. You may (re)define the iter argument to choose which generations to plot." #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." plot_densityridges(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = prior_dist,                    filename = "rsmsmpl/res/figs/rsmsmpl_densityridges_rsm.png",                    colorpal = "OrRd") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." plot_thresholds(data = all_thresholds, nb_threshold = 1,                 filename = "rsmsmpl/res/figs/rsmsmpl_thresholds_rsm.png", colorpal = "OrRd") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'."

title: Use of several distances with ABC-SMC
code: compute_dist <- function(x, ss_obs) {   ss_sim <- c(x[["alpha"]] + x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1),               x[["alpha"]] * x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1))   dist <- (ss_sim - ss_obs)^2 # the function returns a vector of 2 values   return(c(dist)) }  model_list <- list("m1" = compute_dist)

title: Use of several distances with ABC-SMC
code: prior_dist <- list("m1" = list(c("alpha", "unif", 0, 4),                                c("beta", "unif", 0, 1)))

title: Use of several distances with ABC-SMC
code: sum_stat_obs <- c(2.0, 0.75)

title: Use of several distances with ABC-SMC
code: res <- abcsmc(model_list = model_list,               prior_dist = prior_dist,               ss_obs = sum_stat_obs,               max_number_of_gen = 15,               nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen = 2000,               new_threshold_quantile = 0.8,               nb_threshold = 2, # the number of thresholds/distances used has to be indicated               experiment_folderpath = "svrldist",               max_concurrent_jobs = 5,               verbose = FALSE) #> The distance threshold(s) (epsilon(s)) fall(s) below the predetermined min value! #> [1] 0.008796264 0.003911720

title: Use of several distances with ABC-SMC
text: Pairplot iterations Threshold evolution iterations (1) Threshold evolution iterations (2) Density estimates alpha Density estimates beta
code: all_accepted_particles <- res$particles all_thresholds <- res$thresholds plot_abcsmc_res(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = prior_dist,                 filename = "svrldist/res/figs/svrldist_pairplot_all.png", colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2 plot_densityridges(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = prior_dist,                    filename = "svrldist/res/figs/svrldist_densityridges.png", colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." plot_thresholds(data = all_thresholds, nb_threshold = 2, # the number of thresholds/distances used has to be indicated                 filename = "svrldist/res/figs/svrldist_thresholds.png", colorpal = "YlGnBu") #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'."

what: In this example, the model is defined in a separate R file ‘model.R’:
title: Using a model defined in a separate file
text: , procedure pretty much :
code: toy_model <- function(x) {   c(x[["alpha"]] + x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1),     x[["alpha"]] * x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1, 0, 0.1)) } library(BRREWABC) source("model.R")

title: Using a model defined in a separate file
code: compute_dist <- function(x, ss_obs) {   ss_sim <- toy_model(x)   dist <- sum((ss_sim - ss_obs)^2)   return(c(dist)) }  model_list <- list("m1" = compute_dist)

title: Using a model defined in a separate file
code: prior_dist <- list("m1" = list(c("alpha", "unif", 0, 4),                                c("beta", "unif", 0, 1)))

title: Using a model defined in a separate file
code: sum_stat_obs <- c(2.0, 0.75)

title: Using a model defined in a separate file
code: res <- abcsmc(model_list = model_list,               model_def = "model.R",               prior_dist = prior_dist,               ss_obs = sum_stat_obs,               max_number_of_gen = 15,               nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen = 2000,               new_threshold_quantile = 0.8,               experiment_folderpath = "smpl",               max_concurrent_jobs = 5,               verbose = FALSE)

title: Using a model defined in a separate file
text: Pairplot iterations Threshold evolution iterations Density estimates alpha Density estimates beta

what: Batched Resilient and Rapid Estimation Workflow through Approximate Bayesian Computation
title: Batched Resilient and Rapid Estimation Workflow through Approximate Bayesian Computation
text: BRREWABC (Batched Resilient Rapid Estimation Workflow Approximate Bayesian Computation, pronounced “brew abc”: /bruː ˌeɪ.biːˈsiː/) : R package designed facilitate inference parallelized Approximate Bayesian Computation algorithms (Sequential Monte Carlo (ABC SMC), rejection). package streamlines process conducting Bayesian inference complex models implementing efficient parallelization techniques.

title: Batched Resilient and Rapid Estimation Workflow through Approximate Bayesian Computation
text: ABC rejection algorithm approximates posterior distribution sampling parameters prior, simulating data, calculating distance summary statistics simulated observed data. distance falls within predefined tolerance, parameters accepted. process repeated sufficient number parameter sets accepted, approximating posterior distribution parameters given observed data.

title: Batched Resilient and Rapid Estimation Workflow through Approximate Bayesian Computation
text: algorithm used corresponds Approximate Bayesian Computation approach using Sequential Monte Carlo sampler. iterative algorithm enhances basic ABC algorithm incorporating two main steps: weighted resampling simulated particles gradual reduction tolerance. Similar ABC rejection approach, prior distribution defined, aiming estimate posterior distribution. ABC-SMC, estimation achieved sequentially constructing intermediate distributions iteration, converging towards posterior distribution. specific implementation used package improves upon Del Moral et al. (2006) original algorithm 1 three ways: adaptive threshold schedule selection based quantiles distances simulated observed data 2 3 adaptive perturbation kernel width sampling step, dependent previous intermediate posterior distribution 4 5 capability use multiple criteria simultaneously.

title: Batched Resilient and Rapid Estimation Workflow through Approximate Bayesian Computation
text: Parallelized ABC SMC: Conduct inference using Approximate Bayesian Computation Sequential Monte Carlo algorithm, parallelized enhanced computational efficiency. Flexible Model Specification: Easily specify complex models. Customizable Settings: Fine-tune algorithm parameters suit specific modeling needs computational resources. Scalable: Utilize parallel computing capabilities handle large datasets complex models ease. Comprehensive Documentation: Detailed documentation examples guide users package functionality usage.

title: Batched Resilient and Rapid Estimation Workflow through Approximate Bayesian Computation
text: can install development version BRREWABC GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("GaelBn/BRREWABC")

what: Run ABC rejection inference in parallel — abcrejection
title: Run ABC rejection inference in parallel — abcrejection
text: Run ABC rejection inference parallel

title: Run ABC rejection inference in parallel — abcrejection
code:
abcrejection(   model_list = list(),   model_def = NULL,   prior_dist = list(),   ss_obs = NA,   nb_acc_prtcl = 1000,   thresholds = NA,   max_attempts = 1e+05,   acceptance_rate_min = 0.01,   experiment_folderpath = "./",   on_cluster = FALSE,   cluster_type = NULL,   slurm_script_template =     "#!/bin/bash
# THE FOLLOWING SECTION SHOULD NOT BE MODIFIED
#SBATCH --job-name=job-array_%%A_%%a   # nom du job
#SBATCH --ntasks=1
#SBATCH --ntasks-per-node=1
#SBATCH --hint=nomultithread
#SBATCH --time=24:00:00
#SBATCH --array=%s-%s%%%d
output_fpath=%s
error_fpath=%s
#SBATCH --output=$output_fpath/output_%%A_%%a.out
#SBATCH --error=$error_fpath/error_%%A_%%a.out
mkdir -p $output_fpath
mkdir -p $error_fpath
Rscript %s $SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID
",   sge_script_template =     "#!/bin/bash
#$ -S /bin/bash
#$ -N subjob_abcrejection_prlll
# #$ -q "short.q|long.q"
# THE FOLLOWING SECTION SHOULD NOT BE MODIFIED
#$ -cwd
#$ -V
#$ -t %s-%s
#$ -tc %d
#$ -o /dev/null
#$ -e /dev/null
output_fpath=%s
error_fpath=%s
mkdir -p $output_fpath
mkdir -p $error_fpath
Rscript %s $SGE_TASK_ID >$output_fpath/subjob.${SGE_TASK_ID}.out 2>$error_fpath/subjob.${SGE_TASK_ID}.err
",   max_concurrent_jobs = 1,   verbose = FALSE,   progressbar = FALSE )

title: Run ABC rejection inference in parallel — abcrejection
text: model_list list linking model name ( character string) associated function model_def R file containing model(s) function(s) prior_dist list linking model name (character string) list describing prior distribution parameter estimated ss_obs observed summary statistics nb_acc_prtcl number particles (per model, total number corresponding number multiplied number models) accepted thresholds value threshold used select acceptable particles (currently, using multiple distances yet supported method, considered future). NA, particle accepted number parricles equal max_attempts generated max_attempts maximum number particles tested iteration, beyond procedure stops (order prevent excessively long computations) acceptance_rate_min acceptance rate procedure stops (order prevent excessively long computations) experiment_folderpath folder carry estimation procedure save results on_cluster whether procedure run computation cluster cluster_type cluster type used (sge slurm currently supported) slurm_script_template script used launch jobs slurm cluster sge_script_template script used launch jobs sge cluster max_concurrent_jobs maximum number jobs/tasks run parallel verbose whether display specific information progressbar whether display progressbar

text: list containing two dataframes corresponding (1) particles accepted (2) tested particles

what: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
title: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
text: Run ABC-SMC inference parallel

title: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
code:
abcsmc(   model_list = list(),   model_def = NULL,   prior_dist = list(),   ss_obs = NA,   max_number_of_gen = 15,   nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen = 1000,   var_prtrbtn_krnl = NA,   var_prtrbtn_krnl_min = 0.01,   scaling_sd_prtrbtn_krnl = 1,   model_jump_prob = 0.1,   nb_threshold = 1,   new_threshold_quantile = 0.8,   distance_threshold_min = 0.01,   max_attempts = 1e+05,   acceptance_rate_min = 0.01,   use_lhs_for_first_iter = TRUE,   experiment_folderpath = "./",   on_cluster = FALSE,   cluster_type = NULL,   slurm_script_template =     "#!/bin/bash
#SBATCH --ntasks=1
#SBATCH --ntasks-per-node=1
#SBATCH --hint=nomultithread
#SBATCH --time=24:00:00
# THE FOLLOWING SECTION SHOULD NOT BE MODIFIED
#SBATCH --job-name=job-array_%%A_%%a   # nom du job
#SBATCH --array=%s-%s%%%d
output_fpath=%s
error_fpath=%s
#SBATCH --output=$output_fpath/output_%%A_%%a.out
#SBATCH --error=$error_fpath/error_%%A_%%a.out
mkdir -p $output_fpath
mkdir -p $error_fpath
Rscript %s $SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID
",   sge_script_template =     "#!/bin/bash
#$ -S /bin/bash
#$ -N subjob_abcsmc_prlll
# #$ -q "short.q|long.q"
# THE FOLLOWING SECTION SHOULD NOT BE MODIFIED
#$ -cwd
#$ -V
#$ -t %s-%s
#$ -tc %d
#$ -o /dev/null
#$ -e /dev/null
output_fpath=%s
error_fpath=%s
mkdir -p $output_fpath
mkdir -p $error_fpath
Rscript %s $SGE_TASK_ID >$output_fpath/subjob.${SGE_TASK_ID}.out 2>$error_fpath/subjob.${SGE_TASK_ID}.err
",   max_concurrent_jobs = 1,   previous_gens = NA,   previous_epsilons = NA,   verbose = FALSE,   progressbar = FALSE )

title: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
text: model_list list linking model name ( character string) associated function model_def R file containing model(s) function(s) prior_dist list linking model name (character string) list describing prior distribution parameter estimated ss_obs observed summary statistics max_number_of_gen maximum number generations performed nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen number particles (per model, total number corresponding number multiplied number models) accepted generation moving next one var_prtrbtn_krnl standard deviation used perturbation kernel, NA empirical standard deviation used instead var_prtrbtn_krnl_min minimum standard deviation used perturbation kernel (must greater zero) scaling_sd_prtrbtn_krnl scaling parameter increasing decreasing value standard deviation used perturbation kernel model_jump_prob probability changing model creating new particle nb_threshold number thresholds used, corresponding number distances returned function(s) stipulated model list (model_list) new_threshold_quantile quantile used decrease threshold(s) iterations distance_threshold_min minimum threshold procedure stops (order prevent excessively long computations) max_attempts maximum number particles tested iteration, beyond procedure stops (order prevent excessively long computations) acceptance_rate_min acceptance rate procedure stops (order prevent excessively long computations) use_lhs_for_first_iter whether use LHS sampling method first iteration experiment_folderpath folder carry estimation procedure save results on_cluster whether procedure run computation cluster cluster_type cluster type used (sge slurm currently supported) slurm_script_template script used launch jobs slurm cluster sge_script_template script used launch jobs sge cluster max_concurrent_jobs maximum number jobs/tasks run parallel previous_gens object (dataframe) containing previous results (set iterations), order start last iteration performed previous_epsilons object (dataframe) containing previous results (set thresholds), order start last iteration performed verbose whether display specific information progressbar whether display progressbar

title: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
text: list containing two dataframes corresponding (1) particles accepted (2) thresholds used, successive iterations

title: Run ABC-SMC inference in parallel — abcsmc
code: library(BRREWABC)  tmp_dir <- tempdir()  # model definition compute_dist = function(x, ss_obs){     ss_sim = c( x[["alpha"]] + x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1,0,0.1),            x[["alpha"]] * x[["beta"]] + rnorm(1,0,0.1) ) # a simple toy model     dist = sum((ss_sim-ss_obs)^2)     return(c(dist)) }  MODEL_LIST <- list("m1" = compute_dist) PRIOR_DIST <- list("m1" = list(c('alpha', 'unif', 0, 4),                                c('beta', 'unif', 0, 1)))  # create a reference trajectory sum_stat_obs = c(2.0,0.75)  # run abc smc procedure res = abcsmc(model_list = MODEL_LIST, prior_dist = PRIOR_DIST, ss_obs = sum_stat_obs, max_number_of_gen = 20, nb_acc_prtcl_per_gen = 2000, new_threshold_quantile = 0.8, experiment_folderpath = tmp_dir, max_concurrent_jobs = 2, verbose = FALSE) #> The distance threshold(s) (epsilon(s)) fall(s) below the predetermined min value! #> [1] 0.009395208  # get results and plots all_accepted_particles = res$particles all_thresholds = res$thresholds plot_abcsmc_res(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = PRIOR_DIST, colorpal = "YlOrBr", filename = file.path(tmp_dir, "abcsmc_results.png")) #> [1] "Number of generations exceed the threshold (15) allowed by ggpairs, it may cause long processing times. You may (re)define the iter argument to choose which generations to plot." #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2 plot_thresholds(data = all_thresholds, nb_threshold = 1, colorpal = "YlOrBr", filename = file.path(tmp_dir, "thresholds.png")) #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." plot_ess(data = all_accepted_particles, colorpal = "YlOrBr", filename = file.path(tmp_dir, "ess.png")) #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'." #>    gen      ess #> 1    1 2000.000 #> 2    2 1881.776 #> 3    3 1921.409 #> 4    4 1924.558 #> 5    5 1917.493 #> 6    6 1927.471 #> 7    7 1933.534 #> 8    8 1929.084 #> 9    9 1917.282 #> 10  10 1899.739 #> 11  11 1883.403 #> 12  12 1893.386 #> 13  13 1876.607 #> 14  14 1854.769 #> 15  15 1816.457 #> 16  16 1846.034 #> 17  17 1827.470 #> 18  18 1778.830 #> 19  19 1747.601 #> 20  20 1688.389 plot_densityridges(data = all_accepted_particles, prior = PRIOR_DIST, colorpal = "YlOrBr", filename = file.path(tmp_dir, "densityridges.png")) #> [1] "Plot saved as 'png'."

title: BRREWABC 1.0.0
text: First public release.
